isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - IC BUS - BUS CAB ACCESSORIES - OPERATION

svcsubproc.title: Dual Horn Circuitry
svcsubproc.para: Power is applied by body battery feed stud (J1) to circuits 14AA and 14B, fuse F5, and circuit 85 to the coil of horn relay (R1). When the horn button is depressed, power flows through circuit 85B, the horn relay coil and through circuit 85A, connector (222), circuit 85A, connector, circuit 85A, slip ring (J3), circuit 85A, the horn button switch, and circuit 85-GB to the steering column ground.

With the horn relay energized, power flows from circuit 85 through horn relay (R1) N.O. contacts, circuit 85C, dash connector (2), circuit 85C, connector (605), and circuit 85B to a splice. From the splice, power flows through circuit 85D to the low note horn, and 85C to the high note horn. A ground path is provided by the starter ground through circuit 11-GJ, circuit 85-G, connector (605), and circuit 85-G to a splice. From the splice, the high note electric horn is grounded through circuit 85-GA, and the low note electric horn is grounded through circuit 85-GB.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signal Circuitry
svcsubproc.para: Power is applied by body battery feed stud (J1) to circuits 14AA and 14B, fuse F6, circuit 55, flasher (F35), and circuit 55A/60, to circuits 55A and 60 (with tilt steering column) or to circuit 60 (with stationary column) of turn signal switch (193). When the turn signal switch is moved to the left turn position, the switch contacts close and power is applied to connector (193), circuits 56 and 56A to dash connector (2). From connector (2) power is supplied to circuit 56A, front end connector (526) and circuit 56A to left front turn light (503). The ground path is circuit 11-GD/11-GC/11-GB, connector (526) and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to starter ground. From connector (2), power is also supplied by circuit 56 to circuit 56C and connector (27) to the left turn signal indicator (at instrument cluster). The ground path for the left turn signal indicator is conn. (27), and circuit 28-GB/11-G to bus cab ground.

When the turn signal switch is moved to the left turn position, the switch contacts close and power is also applied to connector (193) and circuit 56D to the body builder connector (194) (See Section 7).

When the turn signal switch is moved to the right turn position, the switch contacts close and power is applied to connector (193), circuits 57 and 57A to dash connector (2). From conn. (2) power is supplied to circuit 57A, front end connector (526) and circuit 57A to right front turn light (505). The ground path is circuit 11-GF/11-GE/11-GB, connector (526) and circuit 11-GB, and 11-GJ to starter ground. From connector (2) power is also supplied by circuit 57 to circuit 57C and connector (27) to the right turn signal indicator (at instrument cluster). The ground path for the right turn signal indicator is connector (27), and circuit 28-GB/11-G to bus cab ground.

When the turn signal switch is moved to the right turn position, the switch contacts close and power is also applied to connector (193), and circuit 57D to the body builder connector (194) (See Section 7).

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signal Circuitry With Dual Face Lights
svcsubproc.para: Power is applied by body battery feed stud (J1) to circuits 14AA and 14B, fuse F6, circuit 55, flasher (F35), and circuit 55A/60, to circuits 55A and 60 (with tilt steering column) or to circuit 60 (with stationary column) of turn signal switch (193). When the turn signal switch is moved to the left turn position, the switch contacts close and power is applied to connector (193), circuits 56 and 56A to dash connector (2). From connector (2) power is supplied to circuit 56A, front end connector (526) and circuit 56 to a splice. From the splice, power is supplied to circuit 56A and the left front turn light (503), and circuit 56F to the left dual face turn light (508). The ground path for the left front turn light is circuit 11-GD/11-GC/11-GB, connector (526) and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to starter ground. The ground path for the left front dual face turn light is circuit 11-GG/11-GB, connector (526) and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to starter ground. From connector (2), power is also supplied by circuit 56 to circuit 56C and connector (27) to the left turn signal indicator (at instrument cluster). The ground path for the left turn signal indicator is connector (27), and circuit 28-GB/11-G to bus cab ground.

When the turn signal switch is moved to the left turn position, the switch contacts close and power is also applied to connector (193) and circuit 56D to the body builder connector (194) (See Section 7).

When the turn signal switch is moved to the right turn position, the switch contacts close and power is applied to connector (193), circuits 57 and 57A to dash connector (2). From connector (2) power is supplied to circuit 57A, and front end connector (526). From connector (526) power is supplied to circuit 57 and a splice. From the splice, power is supplied to circuit 57A and the right front turn light (505), and circuit 57F and the right dual face light (509). The ground path for the right front turn light is circuit 11-GF/11-GE/11-GB, connector (526) and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to starter ground. The ground path for the right front dual face turn light is circuit 11-GH/11-GB, connector (526) and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to starter ground. Power is also supplied by circuit 57 to circuit 57C and connector (27) to the right turn signal indicator (at instrument cluster). The ground path for the right turn signal indicator is conn. (27) and circuit 28-GB/11-G to bus cab ground.

When the turn signal switch is moved to the right turn position, the switch contacts close and power is also applied to connector (193), and circuit 57D to the body builder connector (194) (See Section 7).

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signal Circuitry With Stationary Steering Column And With Separate T/S Flasher
svcsubproc.para: Power is applied by body battery feed stud (J1) to circuits 14AA and 14B, fuse F6, circuit 55, hazard flasher (F35), and circuit 55A/60, to circuit 60 of the turn signal switch (193). When the turn signal hazard switch is pulled to the ON position, the hazard switch contacts close and power is applied to connector (193), to circuits 56, 56D, 57 and 57D for the T/S lights, side indicators and body builder connector (194) (See Section 7).

Power is fed on circuits 14AA and 14C, fuse F7, and circuit 15, to the key switch (63), and on circuit 55D, to the coil of the seperate T/S flasher relay (1149), from the body battery feed stud (J1). A ground path is provided by the bus cab ground through circuit 55-G. When key switch (63) is moved to ignition position, energizes the seperate T/S flasher relay (1149) and power is supplied to the separate T/S flasher (1147). Power is applied by bus cab feed stud, to circuit 55, in-line fuse F30, and circuit 55A to the separate flasher relay (1149) (N.O.), in contact (30) and out contact (87), circuit 55B to the separate T/S flasher (1147), on circuit 55C, in the turn signal switch (193).

Power is applied through the turn signal switch (193). When the turn signal switch is moved to the left turn position, the switch contacts close and power is applied to connector (193), circuits 56 and 56A to dash connector (2). From connector (2) power is supplied to circuit 56A, front end connector (526) and circuit 56 to a splice. From the splice, power is supplied to circuit 56A and the left front turn light (503), ((w/dual face) and circuit 56F to the left dual face turn light (508)). The ground path for the left front turn light is circuit 11-GD/11-GC/11-GB, connector (526) and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to starter ground. The ground path for the left front dual face turn light is circuit 11-GG/11-GB, connector (526) and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to starter ground. From connector (2), power is also supplied by circuit 56 to circuit 56C and connector (27) to the left turn signal indicator (at instrument cluster). The ground path for the left turn signal indicator is connector (27), and circuit 28-GB/11-G to bus cab ground.

When the turn signal switch is moved to the left turn position, the switch contacts close and power is also applied to connector (193) and circuit 56D to the body builder connector (194) (See Section 7).

When the turn signal switch is moved to the right turn position, the switch contacts close and power is applied to connector (193), circuits 57 and 57A to dash connector (2). From connector (2) power is supplied to circuit 57A, and front end connector (526). From connector (526) power is supplied to circuit 57 and a splice. From the splice, power is supplied to circuit 57A and the right front turn light (505), ((w/dual face) and circuit 57F and the right dual face light (509)). The ground path for the right front turn light is circuit 11-GF/11-GE/11-GB, connector (526) and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to starter ground. The ground path for the right front dual face turn light is circuit 11-GH/11-GB, connector (526) and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ to starter ground. Power is also supplied by circuit 57 to circuit 57C and connector (27) to the right turn signal indicator (at instrument cluster). The ground path for the right turn signal indicator is conn. (27) and circuit 28-GB/11-G to bus cab ground.

When the turn signal switch is moved to the right turn position, the switch contacts close and power is also applied to connector (193), and circuit 57D to the body builder connector (194) (See Section 7).
